intro: Canthium siebenlistii, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when ripe, containing several seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological systems.
